metadata.title: CVE-2022-32981 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.18.3 on powerpc32-bit platforms. There is a buffer overflow in ptrace PEEKUSER andPOKEUSER (aka PEEKUSR and POKEUSR) when accessing floating point registers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-1022-xilinx-zynqmp - 5.15.0-1022.26
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1007-nvidia - 5.15.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1007-nvidia-64k - 5.15.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1007-nvidia-lowlatency - 5.15.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-nvidia - 6.2.0-1003.3~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-nvidia-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1003-oem - 6.5.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic-64k - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-lowlatency - 6.5.0-14.14.1~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-14.14.1~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1007-starfive - 6.5.0-1007.8~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-gcp - 6.5.0-1010.10~22.04.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1013-oracle - 6.5.0-1013.13~22.04.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-nvidia - 6.5.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-nvidia-64k - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-intel-iot-realtime - 5.15.0-1021.26
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-realtime - 5.15.0-1021.21
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-azure-fde-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-fde-6.2, was needs-triage').
linux-xilinx-zynqmp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.26').
linux-nvidia package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1007.7').
linux-nvidia-6.2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3~22.04.1').
